New Records: LeBron James hit a game-winning three-pointer with 38 seconds left in the fourth quarter to secure the Lakers' 104-99 victory over the Pelicans.
Anthony Davis recorded his third 30-plus point game in his last five appearances.
Rookie Dalton Knecht had a career-best night with 27 points and five three-pointers.
Key Match Events: LeBron James' game-winning three-pointer with less than two minutes left in the fourth quarter was a pivotal moment in the Lakers' victory.
Post-Match Reflections: LeBron James demonstrated his clutch ability despite being 40, showing he's still a key scorer down the stretch.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Lakers extended their winning streak to five consecutive wins.
The game marked a significant milestone as part of the Lakers' schedule.
